extendedIngredients.name: canned white beans
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 (15-ounce) cans white beans (cannellini or great northern), with their liquid

extendedIngredients.name: chicken broth
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 quart homemade or low-sodium canned chicken broth

extendedIngredients.name: garlic
extendedIngredients.originalString: 4 cloves garlic, minced on a microplane grater

extendedIngredients.name: kosher salt
extendedIngredients.originalString: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper

extendedIngredients.name: olive oil
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for serving

extendedIngredients.name: rosemary
extendedIngredients.originalString: 4 6-inch sprigs rosemary, leaves finely chopped and stems reserved

extendedIngredients.name: swiss chard
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3 to 4 cups roughly chopped kale or swiss chard leaves

recipes.title: 30-Minute Tuscan White Bean Soup
recipes.instructions: Procedures                                                                              1                                                                            Heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat until shimmering. Add onions, carrots, and celery and cook, stirring frequently, until softened but not browned, about 3 minutes. Add garlic and dried red pepper flakes and cook, stirring constantly until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add chicken broth, beans and their liquid, rosemary stems, parmesan rind, and bay leaves. Increase heat to high, and bring to a boil. Reduce to a bare simmer, add kale, cover and cook for 15 minutes.                                                                                                                            2                                                                            Discard the bay leaves and rosemary stems. Use a hand blender to roughly puree part of the beans until desired consistency is reached. Alternatively, transfer 2 cups of soup to a blender or food processor and process until smooth (start on low speed and increase to high to prevent blender blow-out). Return to the soup and stir to combine. Season to taste with salt and pepper.                                                                                                                            3                                                                            Ladle into bowls, sprinkle with reserved chopped rosemary leaves, drizzle with extra-virgin olive oil and a grating of Parmigiano-Reggiano, and serve with crusty toasted bread.

steps.step: Heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat until shimmering.
Add onions, carrots, and celery and cook, stirring frequently, until softened but not browned, about 3 minutes.
Add garlic and dried red pepper flakes and cook, stirring constantly until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Add chicken broth, beans and their liquid, rosemary stems, parmesan rind, and bay leaves. Increase heat to high, and bring to a boil. Reduce to a bare simmer, add kale, cover and cook for 15 minutes.

Discard the bay leaves and rosemary stems. Use a hand blender to roughly puree part of the beans until desired consistency is reached. Alternatively, transfer 2 cups of soup to a blender or food processor and process until smooth (start on low speed and increase to high to prevent blender blow-out). Return to the soup and stir to combine. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Ladle into bowls, sprinkle with reserved chopped rosemary leaves, drizzle with extra-virgin olive oil and a grating of Parmigiano-Reggiano, and serve with crusty toasted bread.
